title: Dinner Tonight: Ginger and Cilantro Baked Tilapia
summary: Dinner Tonight: Ginger and Cilantro Baked Tilapia might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 230 calories, 37g of protein, and 5g of fat. This recipe serves 2 and costs $3.87 per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. A mixture of soy sauce, wine, scallion, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 72%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes include Baked Tilapia with Ginger and Cilantro, Ginger And Cilantro Baked Tilapia Recipes From The Kitchn, and Dinner Tonight: Crispy Tilapia With Pico De Gallo Salsa.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Preheat the oven to 475°F. Add the jalapeño, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, white wine, sesame oil, and cilantro to a food processor or blender. Puree until smooth.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper and place in a baking dish just big enough to hold them. Pour the sauce on top.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Place in the oven and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Serve with a garnish of scallion and cilantro.

steps.step: Add the jalapeño, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, white wine, sesame oil, and cilantro to a food processor or blender. Puree until smooth.
Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper and place in a baking dish just big enough to hold them.
Place in the oven and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked.
Serve with a garnish of scallion and cilantro.
